children.name: lubricate
children.definition: to use a substance such as oil to make a machine operate more easily, or to prevent sth sticking or rubbing: tra dầu mỡ, bôi trơn
examples: A car engine needs to be well lubricated with oil.
lubrication[ U ] (US informallube)

lubricant[ C or U ] (US informallube) a liquid such as oil which is used to make the parts of an engine move easily together, or a substance put on any surface to help it move more easily against another one : chất bôi trơn, dầu nhờn

children.name: oil
children.definition: a thick liquid that comes from under the Earth's surface which is used as a fuel and for making parts of machines move easily: dầu ( để bôi trơn )
examples: diesel/ lubricating oil

children.name: regulator
children.definition: nounmáy điều chỉnh; bộ điều chỉnh;bộđiềuhòa
examples: a device used to control things such as the speed of a clock, the temperature in aroom, etc.

children.name: pedal
children.definition: a small part of a machine or object which is pushed down with the foot to operate or move the machine or object: bàn đạp

children.name: the brake/accelerator pedal
examples: This sewing machine is operated by afootpedal.
He stood up on the pedals of his bike to get extra power as he cycled up the hill.

children.name: mechanism
children.definition: a piece of equipment that is designed to do a particular job inside a machine or larger piece of equipment: máy móc
examples: The mechanism that raises the bridge was not working correctly.
Unfortunately, the water had damaged the firing mechanism inside the rocket.
The garlic press uses a screw mechanism to squeeze out juice and pulp.

children.name: roller
children.definition: a tube-shaped object in a machine that turns over and over in order to carry things along or press them down or together: trục lăn, con lăn
examples: As the hot metal passed between the huge rollers it was pressed into thin sheets.

children.name: valve
children.definition: part of a musical instrument such as a trumpet which changes the sound by controlling the flow of air: van

children.name: wheel
children.definition: a circular object connected at the centre to a bar, which is used for making vehicles or parts of machines move: bánh răng
examples: I got my bag caught in the wheel of my bicycle.
He lost control of his car when a front/rear wheel hit a stone as he approached the first bend.

children.name: machine
children.definition: a piece of equipment that does a particular type of work, either in your home or in a factory, office etc, using power from an engine or from electricity: máy

children.name: switch on/turn on a machine
examples: Turn the machine on and slowly add the hot liquid.

children.name: switch off/turn off a machine
examples: Is the tape machine switched off?

children.name: operate/work a machine
examples: Have you been taught to operate the machine properly?

children.name: use a machine
examples: Can you use the copy machine?

children.name: a machine operates/works
examples: The machine works using solar power.

children.name: install a machine
children.definition: put it somewhere and connect it so it can be used
examples: 300 new machines have been installed across the country.

children.name: upgrade a machine
children.definition: add new and better parts to it or replace it with a better one
examples: How much will it cost to upgrade the machine?

children.name: a washing machine
children.definition: for washing clothes
examples: Put your dirty clothes straight in the washing machine.

children.name: a sewing machine
examples: Can I borrow your sewing machine to make some curtains?

children.name: an answering machine
children.definition: for recording telephone messages
examples: There’s a message on the answering machine.

children.name: a coffee machine
children.definition: for providing cups of coffee
examples: She was at the coffee machine last time I saw her.

children.name: a vending machine
children.definition: for supplying drinks, chocolate bars etc
examples: You can buy hot drinks from the vending machine in the corridor.

children.name: a cash/ATM machine
children.definition: for giving you money from your bank account
examples: I need to stop at a cash machine.

children.name: a slot machine
children.definition: for putting coins in in order to try and win more money
examples: The casino has 500 slot machines.

children.name: a life-support machine
children.definition: for keeping a very sick person alive
examples: He has been on a life-support machine since the accident.

children.name: a machine that fills beer bottles
examples: One cable was damaged, which was causing the machine to shut down frequently.
Did you put my dirty shirts in the machine(= washing machine )?
I left a message for you on your machine(= telephone answering machine ).
The machine wouldn’t let me have any money(= cash machine ).

children.name: by machine
examples: The letters are sorted by machine.

children.name: device
children.definition: a piece of equipment, usually a small electronic one, that does a special job:
examples: modern labour-saving devices
device for doing sth
a device for separating metal from garbage
device to do sth
The company makes devices to detect carbon monoxide.
a listening/measuring device
They were both aware that there might be listening devices hidden in the room.
a safety device
The National Association for Elevator Safety says that most elevators have safety devices that prevent free-falls.

children.name: an electronic device
examples: The shops are always full of new electronic devices.

children.name: a mechanical device
children.definition: using power from an engine or machine
examples: One day it will be technically possible to replace patients’ hearts with mechanical devices.

children.name: a simple device
examples: He invented a simple device for chopping onions.

children.name: a clever device
children.definition: made using a clever idea
examples: This clever little device rings to tell you where you left your keys.

children.name: a labour-saving deviceBritish English,a labor-saving deviceAmerican English
children.definition: that reduces the amount of work you have to do
examples: Modern houses have so many labour-saving devices.

children.name: a security device
children.definition: designed to protect against crime
examples: Cars today have better alarms and security devices.

children.name: a safety device
children.definition: designed to keep people safe
examples: The accident happened because a simple safety device wasn’t properly fitted.

children.name: a handheld device
children.definition: that you hold in your hand
examples: This is a handheld device for playing electronic games.

children.name: a storage device
children.definition: a computer device for storing information electronically
examples: You may need an additional storage device if you have a lot of data.

children.name: a medical device
examples: The company makes medical devices that use laser technology for correcting eye disorders.

children.name: appliance
children.definition: a a machine or piece of electrical equipment, usually a large one, that people use in the home: máy móc, đồ gia dụng (bằng điện)
examples: People are spending more of their income on goods such as cars and appliances.
The store sells kitchen appliances such as refrigerators, dishwashers, and toasters.

children.name: domestic/household/home appliance
examples: To make it easier to return any unwanted purchases, save the original packaging, especially for electronics and household appliances.
We carry out repairs on a range of household appliances.

children.name: machinery
children.definition: machines ingeneral, especially the large machines used infactoriesor onfarms:
examples: máy móc
heavy machinery
máy móc hạng nặng
▪ The package says you shouldn’t drive or operate heavy machinery after taking these pills.
industrial/farm machinery
máy móc công nghiệp / nông nghiệp
▪ Industrial machinery and electronic equipment lead the nation’s export list.
▪ a company that manufactures farm machinery
machinerynoun[ U ]MACHINEScơ cấu; máy móc/máy móc nói chung
a group of large machines or the parts of a machine which make it work
_industrial/farm machinery
_His hand was injured when he got it caught in the machinery.

children.name: robot
children.definition: a machine that is controlled by a computer and can do some of the complicated jobs that humans do, such as making things in a factory:
examples: người máy
▪ With the flick of a switch, the robot picks up the bomb, carries it away from buildings, and blows it up.
▪ One astronaut used the space shuttle’s robot arm to pick up an 1800-pound satellite from space.
robotnoun[ C ]MACHINEngười máy; rô-bô
a machine used to perform jobs automatically, which is controlled by a computer

children.name: contraption
children.definition: a device or machine that looks awkward or old-fashioned, especially one that you do not know how to use: :máy kỳ cục
examples: Early cameras were large and expensive contraptions.
By demonstrating his floating contraption - part surfboard, part kayak and part sailboard - Halfon hopes to create a tide of attention.
Whatever's thatstrangecontraption you've got in the garage?

children.name: crank
children.definition: a device which causes movement between parts of a machine or which changes backward and forward movement into circular movement: cái tay quay
examples: a crank handle

children.name: roller
children.definition: a heavy machine used to make surfaces smooth and flat: máy cán
examples: The men used a roller to flatten the tarmac.

children.name: fan
children.definition: a device that is used to move the air around, either an object made of folded paper or other material that you wave with your hand, or an electric device with wide blades that spin round: cái quạt
examples: There was no air conditioning, just a ceiling fan turning slowly.

children.name: mill
children.definition: a small machine for crushing things into powder: máy cán, xay, nghiền, phay
examples: a pepper/ coffee mill

children.name: mixer
children.definition: a machine which mixes substances: máy trộn
examples: a cement mixer
an electric (food) mixer

children.name: drive
children.definition: to provide the power to keep a machine working
examples: The engine drives the wheels.
Water drives the turbines which produce electricity.
petrol-driven/ electrically-driven/ battery-driven etc
a petrol-driven lawn mower

children.name: convenience
children.definition: a device or machine, usually in the house, which operates quickly and needs little effort: tiện nghi
examples: The house has every modern convenience.

children.name: sensitive
children.definition: sensitive equipment is able to record small changes: nhạy
examples: The patient's responses are recorded on a sensitive piece of equipment which gives extremely accurate readings.
ahighly sensitiveelectronic camera
light-sensitive/ heat-sensitive etc
light-sensitive photographic paper

children.name: high technology
children.definition: the most advanced and developed machines and methods: công nghệ cao
examples: a thriving economy built on high technology
